abstract: The cable industry heavily lobbied the commission and allies in Congress to kill a proposal that would give the F.C.C. the power to more tightly regulate the industry.
snippet: The cable industry heavily lobbied the commission and allies in Congress to kill a proposal that would give the F.C.C. the power to more tightly regulate the industry.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 — The head of the Federal Communications Commission is struggling to find enough support from a majority of the agency’s commissioners to regulate cable television companies more tightly.

headline.main: F.C.C. Chief Seeks Votes to Tighten Cable Rules
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Chief Seeks Votes To Tighten Cable Rules
